title: Siddhivinayak Temple
subtitle: The Most Revered Ganesh Temple of Mumbai
overview: The Siddhivinayak Temple, located in Prabhadevi, Mumbai, is one of the most famous and revered temples dedicated to Lord Ganesha in India.
Built in 1801 by Laxman Vithu and Deubai Patil, the temple has become a spiritual landmark attracting millions of devotees from all walks of life.
The black stone idol of Lord Ganesha, with its right-curved trunk, is considered extremely sacred and powerful.
The temple’s calm atmosphere and intricate architecture blend faith and heritage beautifully.

highlights.title: Ancient Temple
highlights.description: Built in 1801, Siddhivinayak Temple stands as a historic and spiritual symbol of Mumbai.

highlights.title: Spiritual Power
highlights.description: The temple’s idol of Ganesha is said to grant the wishes of true devotees.

geography.intro: Siddhivinayak Temple is situated in Prabhadevi, South Mumbai, amidst the bustling heart of India’s financial capital.

climate.description: Mumbai has a coastal tropical climate with warm weather throughout the year, making the temple accessible year-round.

seasons.text: Best time to visit is November to February when the weather is pleasant.
Monsoon (June–September) adds charm but may cause heavy crowding.

geography.conclusion: Being in the heart of Mumbai, Siddhivinayak Temple is easily accessible and can be visited comfortably any time of the year.

activities.title: Aarti & Darshan
activities.description: Witness the divine morning and evening Aartis, offering spiritual peace and blessings.

activities.title: Offer Modaks
activities.description: Devotees offer Modaks, Lord Ganesha’s favorite sweet, as a sign of devotion.
info: Fresh modaks available near temple premises.

activities.title: Charity & Seva
activities.description: Participate in temple-run charities supporting education, healthcare, and welfare.
info: Temple Trust conducts numerous social activities.
You can contribute online or in person.

attractions.title: Haji Ali Dargah
attractions.description: A beautiful Indo-Islamic structure located in the middle of the Arabian Sea, symbolizing Mumbai’s spiritual harmony.

attractions.title: Worli Sea Face
attractions.description: A scenic seaside promenade offering panoramic views and a relaxing environment.

marineLife.intro: While Siddhivinayak Temple is a religious landmark rather than a coastal site, the nearby Arabian Sea adds a soothing charm to the environment.

items.title: Coastal Serenity
items.description: The temple’s proximity to the sea gives a calm and rejuvenating ambiance.

items.title: Nearby Beaches
items.description: Visit Girgaon Chowpatty or Dadar Beach for sunset views after your darshan.

conclusion: Enjoy the coastal charm of Mumbai alongside your spiritual visit.
Ideal for travelers seeking both peace and city exploration.

howToReach.title: By Train
details: Local trains from Western, Central, and Harbour lines stop here.

howToReach.title: By Air
details: Nearest airport: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (16 km).
Cabs and app-based taxis easily available from the airport.

bookingTips.description: Visit early morning (5:30–8:00 AM) to avoid long queues.
Tuesdays and festivals see huge crowds—plan accordingly.
Use the official temple website for online darshan and donation.
